tv.generator-info-name: Original XML Generated with Tempest EPG Generator (made by Kvanc) - Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v0.9

programme.title: rage Vault: Tony Van Den Ende
programme.desc: rage dives into the Vault and lines up clips directed by Tony Van Den Ende, from Flock Of Seagulls to Simply Red, Transvision Vamp, Thomas Dolby, Kim Wilde and more.

programme.title: The Art Of Climate
programme.desc: Zoe Norton Lodge and Namila Benson want to know if art can help our climate. With OITNB star Yael Stone, artist Ghenoa Gela, sculptor Megan Copes living eco solution and artist Jessie Frenchs extraordinary "plastic".

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Teenage Boss: Next Level
programme.desc: A lover of surprises, Bens secret savings goal is put under pressure as he tries to keep little sister and mum on side.

programme.title: Prince Charles Inside The Duchy Of Cornwall
programme.desc: We examine the lifes work of Prince Charles as the longest serving Duke of Cornwall - referred to simply by his staff and tenants as the Boss.

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: Tom Gleeson is hanging on to the Big Brass Mug until one Hard Quiz expert can prove they deserve it - but with which topic? Australian parrots, cricket bats, bones, or WikiLeaks?

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.desc: When Astrid Jorgensen started Pub Choir in a small Brisbane bar, she never imagined she would be filling halls across the world eight years later.

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: Australias leading forum for media analysis and comment. Host Linton Besser, a four-time Walkley award-winning investigative reporter and former foreign correspondent, brings you a fearless critique of the weeks journalism.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the story with the latest on the days events, explaining whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe uncovering what you need to know. Presented by Craig Smart.

programme.title: Foreign Correspondent
programme.desc: For Gazas one million children growing up isnt guaranteed. For almost two years more than 18,000 kids have been killed as Israel wages war to destroy Hamas. An intimate look at the toll the war is taking on Gazas littlest.

programme.title: A Life In Ten Pictures
programme.desc: Nelson Mandelas image is famous around the world. But just a handful of iconic shots and private snaps reveal a new story: its an extraordinary life through a unique lens.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Jerry goes to a bamboo nursery, Jane looks at flowering native shrubs, Costa grows crops in pots, Clarence prunes native shrubs, our guest presenter multiplies perennials, and we look at plants under the microscope.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Donald Trump to meet with Benjamin Netanyahu - is peace in the Middle East closer? Plus the latest on James Comeys indictment, the looming deadline over a government shutdown, plus tariffs on pharmaceuticals and migration.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Prince Charles Inside The Duchy Of Cornwall
programme.desc: We ask what the Prince of Wales legacy for the Duchy will be, as senior staff prepare HRH Prince William for the day that he will succeed his father to become the next Duke of Cornwall. (Final)

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: Four know-it-alls want Tom Gleesons Big Brass Mug: an Android smartphone aficionado, a Sydney Opera House tour guide, an AFL umpire, and someone who is into people getting hit with padded poles on the TV show Gladiators.

programme.title: Foreign Correspondent
programme.desc: An uneasy calm has returned to Iran. In June, the country was in the grip of a 12-day war as Israel targeted Irans nuclear facilities. Jonathan Miller is in the Islamic Republic to find out if the world is any safer. (Final)

programme.title: ABBA: Against The Odds
programme.desc: The inside story of ABBAs struggle: critical backlash, relationship break up and social change to becoming the biggest pop group of the 1970s. Told by ABBA and those close to them.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Kirsten Aiken presents your daily roundup of business and finance news, including market reaction and analysis from economists after the Reserve Banks September decision on interest rates and the Governors statement.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: With the third form on a trip to the circus, Darrell and Sally attempt to recover the confiscated peaches from Miss Johnsons office, but they find more than they expected...

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: When a hipster grocery store clerk shames the Bears for asking for plastic grocery bags, they realize that ecofriendly tote bags are their way of gaining acceptance among the progressive people of the Bay Area.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: A friend of Adriens gets akumatized into Lies. Able to make liars disappear, she is determined to rid the world of lies and those who tell them... including superheroes!

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: It is a peaceful night at the farm, until Shaun starts to walk in his sleep. The Flock cannot resist their natural instinct to follow, and chaos soon ensues.

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: The London Girls have self-belief, attitude and quick wits and theyll need all of that in their aim to conquer the Maze. Will Richard Ayoade be able to control the kamikaze bunch?

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.desc: Gem celebrates all things Pokemon with special guest Harry! Plus, Screen Goblin drops his Pikachu diss track, games for when youve finally caught them all in Pokemon and another dating disaster in Finding Player 2!

programme.title: Officially Amazing
programme.desc: Watch in wonder as two awesome wakeboarders, a pool playing wizard, and a man on a tiny unicycle try to break records.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: Darrell and Sally are determined to solve the mystery of the Malory ghost, but discover the truth is far more complex than they could ever have imagined.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Charlie (aka Bigfoot) is a solo guy who, like the Bears, would love to find a place for himself in the world. In an effort to do so, Charlie throws a party but ends up going on an adventure with the unlikeliest of animals.

programme.title: Miraculous World: Shanghai, Lady Dragon
programme.desc: On the occasion of a school break, Marinette heads to Shanghai to meet Adrien... and discover her own origins.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: When the Farmers niece comes to stay, Shaun and Bitzer soon discover she isnt as cute and adorable as she seems.

programme.title: Expedition With Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve heads to the Moukalaba Doudou National Park in Gabon. Alongside primatologists and jungle experts, he wants to discover whether this unexplored rainforest could be home to an undiscovered population of chimpanzees.

programme.title: Louis Theroux Interviews Stormzy
programme.desc: Stormzy welcomes Louis into his home for a revealing conversation covering many topics from his childhood, the breakdown of a high-profile relationship and the pressures of being one of the UKs best loved musicians.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors find out what happens when you eat with the help of a miniature Xand doll, test your ears and eyes in a baffling mind-bending trick, and join Dr Chris at work fighting infectious diseases.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: A Miraculous Conclusion! Farewell Goku! Until We Meet Again!
programme.desc: Goku and Jiren are at the end of their ropes as the clock winds down! Will the 7th Universe finally emerge victorious?!

programme.title: Space Nova
programme.desc: Jet devises a bread-based duplicate of himself to take his place at a boring event - but the plan backfires.

programme.title: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic
programme.sub-title: The Fault In Our Cutie Marks
programme.desc: The Crusaders encounter a problem that might be impossible for them to solve when an enthusiastic young griffin asks them to help her get a Cutie Mark of her own.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.sub-title: Batman V Teen Titans: Dark Injustice
programme.desc: The Titans try to outprank each other on April Fools Day.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.sub-title: Exploding Toilet / Who Gest Wetter? / Ice Bullet
programme.desc: Will a toilet filled with bug spray explode? Which keeps you drier; running or walking in the rain? Plus the MythBusters test bullets made of ice that are thought to kill without leaving clues.

programme.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us
programme.sub-title: The Penn and Teller 50th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: Magicians include Young and Strange, Piff and Piero Venesia, and theres an amazing two-act trick by Penn and Teller.

programme.title: rage Guest Programmer: Evan Dando
programme.desc: Join The Lemonheads legendary frontman Evan Dando as he guests programs rage this weekend, picking clips from You Am I, Stevie Nicks, Heart, Godstar and more.

programme.title: Changing Ends
programme.desc: A Sex-Ed lesson and the impending school disco strike fear into Alans heart... why is everyone talking about kissing girls?! Graham has girl trouble of his own with a female linewoman.

programme.title: Heartbreak High
programme.desc: Matts father returns to force him to come home, meanwhile Steve is nowhere to be seen.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: A Peacetime Reward: Who Gets The 100,000,000 Zeni?
programme.desc: Peace has settled on Earth, and unfortunately for Goku, that means getting a job! But a generous gift may change that. Meanwhile, Trunks and Goten seek a pre-wedding gift for Videl.

programme.title: Space Nova
programme.desc: The Novas land on an eerie, spooky planet they think is abandoned, only to get the fright of their lives from extraterrestrial inhabitants not keen on visitors!

programme.title: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic
programme.desc: When Rarity opens her flagship store in Manehattan, a tell-all article threatens to expose how badly her friends almost ruined the Grand Opening.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Robin finally teaches the other Titans a valuable lesson.

programme.title: George Clarkes Old House New Home
programme.desc: George visits a Georgian townhouse on a cobbled street in Cheshire that could be straight out of a Dickens novel, but what does it look like inside? Plus, George has his work cut out tackling a 380 year old Jacobean cottage.

programme.title: Austin
programme.desc: When Julian gets fired from his publisher and told his remaining books are to be pulped, Austin leads the charge to break into the warehouse to rescue whatever books are left.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Dibillo decides to wear his favourite bow tie for the day. Mr Onion is very excited, and takes Dibillo around the house to show everybody how smart he looks.

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: Beep and Mort come across a bird singing a beautiful song in the forest. They work with the villagers to create a gift for the bird so that the bird might gift them with its song once again.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: It seems everyone in Hoopla has a hula hoop, everyone except Zap. So Ziggy gives him a beginners model but Zap cant get his hoop to hula.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collectors house is trashed. But maybe Mole isnt the culprit this time.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing is getting ready to go to Sulas house but hes all sneezy and hot so Flop decides that Bing needs to stay home and keep his germs to himself.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle shows Peppa and her school friends how to make a time capsule. The children discover that their parents made a time capsule with Madame Gazelle many, many years ago. And now it is time to open it up.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Flock are delighted when a bird watcher drops his duck call in their field and Shaun uses it to entertain them. However, swallowing the duck call isnt what he had in mind - and the ducks arent too happy either.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Despite constant interruptions, Mandy tries to stay calm and earn her yoga badge - until disaster strikes and she needs to be rescued from a cliff ledge!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly joins Ben and his family on an Elf trip to the seaside, and Mr Elf tells her that no magic is to be used. But when they realise that no one has remembered to pack lunch they ask Holly to use her magic to make some.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its finally the day of the babys arrival! Mummy and Daddy Pig rush to the hospital, but Peppa and George must stay with Granny and Grandpa Pig instead.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets host a do something new for you day on Kangaroo Beach in an effort to help support Pounce while he learns a tricky new skill.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Drac and his Monster Pets help a mermaid embrace her uniqueness by learning to glide above water.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Messiest Mango
programme.desc: Jay dreams of being crowned the messiest mango eater ever, ever, ever, but Appa doesnt want drips on the clean floor. So Jay eats his mango in the bath!

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie, Nina and Akil are exploring musical instruments. Eddie learns how to play the xylophone by looking, touching, playing, and finally - enjoying making music in a band.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: What do you do when life gives you lemons? Make a DIY volcano of course! An episode exploding with fun, join Luke in the Science Time lab as he uses lemons and other ingredients to make an extra epic erupting volcano.

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Caterina needs some help remembering the days of the week! Sing along to help her remember, and then the learning fun continues with a dance music remix of ABC.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Cheer for CH and shout for SH as they compete to see who is the champion. This episode introduces the letter teams CH and SH and the words shop, chop, chip, ship, shin, chin, shed, mash, cash and sash.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mandy Mouse has a birthday visit to a cheese theme park with Peppa and her friends. Everything in the park is cheese-themed - Mandy loves cheese!

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger and the baby Pea-Rexes go on an underwater adventure inside a rubbery bubble made by a young and friendly Watermelonsuchus, but things take a turn when the Bananaraptors get involved.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Pola is pretending to be a horse for Bobby and Tish but just before its Tishs turn, Pola gets up saying he wants a rest.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Stanley must keep Myrtles pumpkin safe from Speedy the snail.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Gekko tries to get Pirate Robot to be a chef instead of a pirate.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets host a do something new for you day on Kangaroo Beach in an effort to help support Pounce while he learns a tricky new skill.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Thomas finds a way to take part in the Brazilian carnival music.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Hannah and the junior gardeners celebrate her goats Gilly and Gerties birthday with a special fruity surprise a fruit cake made entirely out of fruit!

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: The Wiggles are a having a singing lesson today, singing a gentle song called Butterfly, Fly Butterfly, but Captain Feathersword is having trouble singing softly. Will Captain find his quiet voice?

programme.title: Ariel
programme.desc: Flounder helps other chefs at an event.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her friends are playing hide and seek, but its Freddy Fox with his super smelling nose who is the best at playing that game.

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: Stranded in an Australian swamp, Peso and Dashi help a flying fox mother and her pup survive the sweltering heat.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo dont want to tidy the playroom, so they get Daddy Robot to do it for them. But when Bluey takes things too far, Daddy Robot malfunctions with disastrous results.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Its time for a Squirrel Clubhouse Spring Clean. Duggee is dusting when the doorbell goes and a big package arrives for him. What is it? Duggee has bought an amazing new hoover, but yikes! Its very powerful.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertato harnesses the power of his hiccups to save Tato Tower from Evil Peas jam attack.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: After Dad eats her last chip, Bingo is given three chances to put Mum and Dad in Dance Mode as payback. But the others cant resist taking Bingos turns for her.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: In the Toy House, everybody is reading books when the little toy tub appears, Moon Baby catches it. In Storyland, the big tub appears and Moon Baby decides he will catch that too.

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: Mort wakes up with a case of the grumps that begin to spread throughout Mollyvale! Beep, Mort and Pop work together to turn the situation around and save Mollyvale from this unhappy affliction.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Bop has a lots of things to fix so he needs to go fast. However, the faster Bop goes the more things he breaks. Mimi has an idea to Bop-proof Hoopla.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collectors hearing aids stop working, luckily he knows how to mend them!

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing is playing Hide and Seek at the creche with Sula, Pando and Coco. Bing doesnt go to the toilet before the game starts and when he needs to go before he is found he has to decide whether to give up his hiding spot.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are at the seaside. Peppa and George like sandy beaches, but this is a different kind of beach, with lots of rocks and little rock pools to explore.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: While the Farmers back is turned the Flock take the opportunity to have a game of football. When the ball accidentally lands inside the farmhouse, Shaun comes up with an ingenious disguise to help retrieve it.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: A Go-Kart Challenge goes topsy-turvy when Peters Go-Kart catches fire and sets ablaze everything in its path!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly forgets Bens birthday, and rushes home to make him a birthday card. But Nanny has stopped all magic, so Holly has to make the card herself. When she takes the card to Ben she is embarrassed that it is hand-made.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: With the baby now born, Peppa makes it her mission to find the perfect name. After many failed attempts, Peppa finally finds the perfect name with the help from the family album.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Pounce role-plays as legendary lifeguard Super Roo. Meanwhile, Frizzy helps Wanda make a Big Thing.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: The Super Monsters reimagine Alice in Wonderland with creativity, teamwork, and magical twists.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Never-Done-It-Day
programme.desc: When Nana reveals shes never had a dosa, the family all try something new and have a Never-Done-It day! Will Nikhil and Jay be able to find something Jim has never done before?

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Taking the train to Grandpas house is so exciting! Eddie prepares for the journey by learning about speed and the possible events during the journey.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: How does a plant drink water? Rachael is learning about capillary action by making a rainbow water experiment using water glasses and paper towels. This episode will have you soaking up all sorts of fun facts!

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: You can find fun, musical sounds anywhere! Evie and Lucia are making sounds on a comb and an empty stapler, and they decide to hear what sounds the rest of The Wiggles have found to create a song.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: The Alphablocks invite you to sing along to a singalong song! This episode introduces the letter team NG and the words sing, song, ring, king, ting, ping, ding-dong, pong and bang.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her friends are playing hide and seek, but its Freddy Fox with his super smelling nose who is the best at playing that game.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Tish has been invited to the waterpark with her friend Cori but Pola peers into Tishs room to let her know all the family is sick!

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: Prickly insists he "doesnt like" ice skating. Vida gives him vet care AND sage advice.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Cynthia needs Stanley to use the train to deliver some parcels. What could go wrong?

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Pounce role-plays as legendary lifeguard Super Roo. Meanwhile, Frizzy helps Wanda make a Big Thing.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Diesel plays a trick on Rebecca to try and get the other engines in trouble for a change.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Clarence and Molly go on the ultimate adventure to find the coolest bugs in the garden.

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Its playtime at Wiggle House! The Wiggles are having a fun playing with their beloved toys, singing along to The Transportation Parade and grab your favourite toy and join the fun!

programme.title: Ariel
programme.desc: A new fish wants an adventure of her own.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Doctor Hamster the vet comes to Peppas playgroup to show the children her pets.

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: Peso and Kwazii attempt to incubate a lone puffin egg, while Barnacles and Tunip search the Arctic seas for its missing parents.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: On a picnic in the park, Bluey and her friends play Shadowlands. But when Coco keeps taking shortcuts, Bluey has to show her that following the rules can make the game more fun.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The circus has come to town and the Squirrels are very excited until they see its a flea circus. Its so tiny! It doesnt seem very impressive until they get to see some of the acts like Fifi and her daring tightrope act!

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: A toy dinosaur rampages through the supermarket and scares the Grape Kids. Carrot and Supertato work out that its controlled by a remote control and try to get the dinosaur back in its box.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Mum are off to Chloes party and Bingo isnt invited. But armed with a magic featherwand that makes things incredibly heavy, Bingo can now stop them leaving the house.

programme.title: Offsiders
programme.desc: Abbey Gelmi and the panel Jessica Stewart, Adam Kingsley and Corbin Middlemas analyse the Brisbane Lions premiership win over Geelong in the AFL Grand Final, Rugby League Preliminary Finals and the first Bledisloe Cup Test.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: The long-awaited autopsy about a death in custody in Alice Springs released by police, pensioners forced for forgo crucial medical treatments due to cost, plus families set up an organisation to look into missing persons.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: As the day begins get the facts you need to stay informed. Bridget Brennan and Emma Rebellato bring you the latest news, overnight developments and top stories, joined by Catherine Murphy on sport and Nate Byrne with weather.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Kathryn Robinson brings you todays top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter most.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to cover whats happening and why it matters. Kathryn Robinson brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Get a head start on the week as Chas and John break down the latest from Trumps America, bringing their unique analysis and insightful interviews to the ABCs powerhouse Monday Night Lineup.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: As the Reserve Banks monetary board meet to decide on interest rates, Kirsten Aiken presents your daily roundup of business and finance news, including market predictions ahead of tomorrows announcement from the RBA.

programme.title: If Youre Listening
programme.sub-title: What are Trumps Plans in Venezuela?
programme.desc: Why is the US military taking pot-shots at speedboats off the coast of Venezuela? Its actually follows a playbook theyve used before. So what happened last time, and should Venezuelas Nicolas Maduro be watching his back?

programme.desc: Yvonne Yong looks at the week from Asia: Typhoon Ragasa carves a path of destruction through the northern Philippines and Taiwan; a giant sinkhole opens up in Bangkok, and an outdoor brand under fire for a display in Tibet.

programme.title: Live: Interest Rate Decision
programme.desc: After three interest rate cuts so far in 2025, the Reserve Bank announce their September decision on interest rates. August CPI data has core inflation close to the RBA inflation target and unemployment is steady at 4.2%.
